debate these issues Ethics Ethical standards in discipline have changed over time Some famous past studies are today considered unethical in violation established codes Canadian Code Conduct Research Involving Humans Belmont Report most important contemporary standards are informed voluntary consent After World War II Nuremberg Code was established Nazi abuses experimental subjects Later most countries scientific journals adopted Declaration Helsinki In U S National Institutes Health established Institutional Review Board in in adopted National Research Act HR All these measures encouraged researchers obtain informed consent from human participants in experimental studies number influential studies led establishment this rule such studies included MIT Fernald School radioisotope studies Thalidomide tragedy Willowbrook hepatitis study Stanley Milgram s studies obedience authority Humans University psychology departments have ethics committees dedicated rights well being research subjects Researchers in psychology must gain approval research projects before conducting any experiment protect interests human participants laboratory animals ethics code American Psychological Association originated in as Ethical Standards Psychologists This code has guided formation licensing laws in most American states It has changed multiple times over decades since its adoption In APA revised its policies on advertising referral fees negotiate end an investigation by Federal Trade Commission incarnation was first distinguish between aspirational ethical standards enforceable ones Members public have five year window file ethics complaints about APA members with APA ethics committee members APA have three year window Some ethical issues considered most important are requirement practice only within area competence maintain confidentiality with patients avoid sexual relations with them Another important principle informed consent idea that patient research subject must understand freely choose procedure they are undergoing Some most common complaints against clinical psychologists include sexual misconduct involvement in child custody evaluations Other animals Current ethical guidelines state that using non human animals scientific purposes only acceptable harm physical psychological done animals outweighed by benefits research Keeping this in mind psychologists can use certain research techniques on animals that could not be used on humans An experiment by Stanley Milgram raised questions about ethics scientific experimentation extreme emotional stress suffered by participants It measured willingness study participants obey an authority figure instructed them perform acts that conflicted with personal conscience Comparative psychologist Harry Harlow drew moral condemnation isolation experiments on rhesus macaque monkeys at University Wisconsin Madison in s aim research was produce an animal model clinical depression Harlow also devised he called rape rack which female isolates were tied in normal monkey mating posture In American literary critic Wayne C Booth wrote that Harry Harlow his colleagues go on torturing nonhuman primates decade after decade invariably proving we all knew in advance that social creatures can be destroyed by destroying social ties He writes that Harlow made no mention criticism morality his work References Fernald LD Psychology Six perspectives pp Thousand Oaks CA Sage Publications Hockenbury Hockenbury Psychology Worth Publishers Although psychoanalysis other forms depth psychology are most typically associated with unconscious mind behaviorists consider such phenomena as classical conditioning operant conditioning while cognitivists explore implicit memory automaticity subliminal messages all which are understood either bypass occur outside conscious effort attention Indeed cognitive behavioral therapists counsel clients become aware maladaptive thought patterns nature which clients previously had not been conscious Cacioppo John September Psychology Hub Science Aps Observer psychology hub discipline that discipline in which scientific research cited by scientists in many other fields instance medicine draws from psychology most heavily through neurology psychiatry whereas social sciences draw directly from most specialties within psychology would have been largest certainly most generously funded behavioral research project in U S history With million contract over period years it was considered often called veritable Manhattan Project behavioral sciences at least by many intellectuals whose services were in heavy demand Cocks Psychotherapy in Third Reich pp Cocks Psychotherapy in Third Reich p Cocks Psychotherapy in Third Reich pp Schultz Hencke in this essay life goals were determined by ideology not by science In case psychotherapy he defined health in terms blood strong will proficiency discipline Zucht und Ordnung community heroic bearing physical fitness Schultz Hencke also took opportunity in criticize psychoanalysis providing an unfortunate tendency toward exculpation criminal J rgen Brunner Matthias Schrempf Florian Steger Johannes Heinrich Schultz National Socialism Israel Journal Psychiatry Related Sciences Bringing these people right deep understanding every German s duty in New Germany such as preparatory mental aid psychotherapy in general in particular persons be sterilized people having been sterilized great important rewarding medical duty Cocks Psychotherapy in Third Reich Chapter Reconstruction Repression pp b Kozulin Psychology in Utopia pp Against such background it not at all surprising that psychoanalysis as theory that ventured approach forbidden but topical theme sexual relations was embraced by newborn Soviet psychology Psychoanalysis also attracted interest Soviet psychology as materialist trend that had challenged credentials classical introspective psychology reluctance pre Revolutionary establishment propagate psychoanalysis also played positive role in post Revolutionary years it was field uncompromised by ties old regime science Though c f Hannah Proctor Reason Displaces All Love New Inquiry February Kozulin Psychology in Utopia p Stalin s purges s did not spare Soviet psychologists Leading Marxist philosophers earlier associated with psychology including Yuri Frankfurt Nikolai Karev Ivan Luppol were executed in prison camps same fate awaited Alexei Gastev Isaak Shipilrein Those survived lived in an atmosphere total suspicion People dominated fields yesterday might be denounced today as traitors enemies people by tomorrow names might disappear from all public records Books newspapers were constantly being recalled from libraries rid them obsolete names references Kozulin Psychology in Utopia pp Kozulin Psychology in Utopia pp Georgy Schedrovitsky currently at Moscow Institute Psychology can be singled out as most prominent theorist working in context systems research This Schedrovitsky s second major thesis Activity should not be regarded as an attribute individual but rather as an all embracing system that captures individuals forces them behave certain way This approach may be traced back assertion Wilhelm Humboldt that it not man has language as an attribute but rather language that possesses man Schedrovitsky s activity approach has been applied successfully design man machine systems evaluation human factors in urban planning Chin Chin Psychological Research in Communist China pp Chin Chin Psychological Research in Communist China pp Soviet psychology that Peking modeled itself upon was Marxist Leninist psychology with philosophical base in dialectical materialism newly added label Pavlovianism This new Soviet psychology leaned heavily on Lenin s theory reflection which was unearthed in his two volumes posthumously published in Toward late twenties group Soviet research psychologists headed by Vygotskii along with Luria Leont ev laid groundwork Marxist Leninist approach psychic development Chin Chin Psychological Research in Communist China pp b c d e f g h Wade Pickren Raymond D Fowler Professional Psychology Today Retrieved April Panksepp J Affective neuroscience foundations human animal emotions New York Oxford University Press p Teo Critique Psychology pp Methodologism means that method dominates problem problems are chosen in subordination respected method psychology has adopt without question methods natural sciences From an epistemological ontological critical as well as from human scientific perspective experiment in psychology has limited value example only basic psychological processes given nature psychological subject matter reality persons capabilities Teo Critique Psychology p Pervasive in feminist critiques science with exception feminist empiricism rejection positivist assumptions including assumption value neutrality that research can only be objective if subjectivity emotional dimensions are excluded in fact culture personality institutions play significant roles see Longino Longino Doell psychology Grimshaw discussed behaviorism s goals modification suggested that behaviorist principles reinforced hierarchical position between controller controlled that behaviorism was in principle an antidemocratic program Edwin R Wallace IV Two Mind Body Models Psychological Testing p Berry Robert M From Involuntary Sterilization Genetic Enhancement Unsettled Legacy Buck v Bell Notre Dame Journal Law Ethics Public Policy Gregory Psychological Testing p From birth old age we encounter tests at almost every turning point in life Tests are used in almost every nation on earth counseling selection placement Testing occurs in settings as diverse as schools civil service industry medical clinics counseling centers Most persons have taken dozens tests thought nothing it Yet by time typical individual reaches retirement age it likely that psychological test results will have helped shape his her destiny Gregory Psychological Testing pp b George Stricker Thomas Widiger Volume Preface in Weiner ed Handbook Psychology Volume Clinical Psychology Brain
